column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Calculate Accident Incident Rate

#Text=The Occupational Safety and Health Administration ( OSHA ) is a regulatory agency of the federal government that ensures , as much as possible , that American workers operate in a safe working environment .
#Text=The organization requires certain businesses to report their statistics concerning accidents , injuries and other incidents that occur while on the job .
#Text=Accidents and incidents are logged on an OSHA 300 form that is usually tracked on a spreadsheet .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Determining If Your Business Must Report Incidents to OSHA
#Text=Count the number of employees in your company .
#Text=If your company had 10 or fewer employees at all times during the previous calendar year , then you do not need to report incidents to OSHA .
#Text=Determine your industry .
#Text=Every business is part of a particular industry or sector .
#Text=Before you can determine whether or not you need to report incidents to OSHA , you need to understand what industry you 're part of .
#Text=Industries are usually defined by broad categories like " Construction , " " IT Services , " " Food Service , " etc.

column1: #Text=Pick a keyword or two that best describes your business .
#Text=You 'll need that for the next step .
#Text=Get the NAICS for your business .
#Text=The NAICS is the North American Industry Classification .
#Text=It 's a 6-digit code that 's used to classify a business .
#Text=The federal government uses the code to maintain statistics about the types of businesses that exist in the United States .
#Text=Visit the NAICS search site .
#Text=Enter a keyword that describes your business in the field in the upper , right-hand corner of the screen , just above the button that reads " 2007 NAICS Search " .
#Text=OSHA still classifies industries based on the older NAICS codes , so you 'll need to use that search instead of the newer , 2012 search .
#Text=Click the " 2007 NAICS Search " button .
#Text=The new page that appears will be a list of NAICS codes and businesses .
#Text=Select the NAICS code that best describes your business .
#Text=For example , if your business is a restaurant and you put " restaurant " in the search field , you 'll see a variety of codes with descriptions that include the word " restaurant .
